name: SIUT
mission: Established in 2000, SIUT North America is a charitable organization under Section 501(c)(3). It is dedicated to health-related humanitarian causes, with its major focus on helping Sindh Institute of Urology and Transplantation (SIUT) Pakistan secure vital medical funds so all patients are treated free of charge and without discrimination.
theoryOfChange: SIUT North America raises and provides funding/grants to SIUT Pakistan so patients receive lifesaving, world-class medical treatment completely free of cost and with dignity, ensuring no patient is turned away due to financial hardship.
zakatClaimEvidence: SIUT North America, Inc. has a 'Select a campaign' option on Kindful that includes 'Zakat'. Additionally, Feeling Blessed states, 'Your Zakat and Sadaqah has the power to save lives. Donate to SIUTNA and help us provide free healthcare with dignity.' (Source: https://siutna.org/ways-to-donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 44/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: Beneficiary count appears implausible; CPB excluded pending review
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a Charity Navigator score of 92.0/100 and maintains specific financial health metrics.
The organization provides grants for medicine and equipment to support medical missions.
SIUT North America pays grants specifically for medical equipment and medicine.
The charity provides grants and assistance to foreign organizations to facilitate kidney transplants and dialysis.
Funds are utilized for diagnostic and prognosis measures through grants for medicine.
The organization offers various donation options and is recognized as Zakat-eligible.
The organization reported total revenue of $5,921,512 and a program expense ratio of 84.0%.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a GMG score of 79/100 due to its high Charity Navigator score of 92.0/100 and its direct service model in the humanitarian sector. Its high alignment score reflects its strong fit for donors looking for urgent medical interventions.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital is limited to 4.0 months, which may affect long-term sustainability
Heavy reliance on international grants and assistance to foreign organizations

dimension_explanations.alignment: SIUT North America shows strong alignment with humanitarian causes, particularly for donors interested in Zakat-eligible medical relief [6]. The organization maintains a high donor fit by focusing on urgent healthcare needs and maintaining transparent financial reporting [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates a high direct service impact by funding essential medical equipment and medicine [3][5]. With a total revenue of $5,921,512 and a program expense ratio of 84.0%, the organization efficiently directs its resources toward patient care and kidney transplants [1][7].

baseline_narrative.headline: SIUT North America Inc provides critical financial support for life-saving dialysis and kidney transplant services through the SIUT Charitable Trust.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 84.0% ensuring most funds reach medical programs
Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.17 per $1 raised
Designated as Zakat-eligible for Muslim donors seeking humanitarian impact
baseline_narrative.summary: SIUT North America Inc is a registered 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to supporting the SIUT Charitable Trust's mission of providing free medical care [2][7]. The organization focuses on funding diagnostic measures, dialysis treatments, and kidney transplants for patients in need [3][4].

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization maintains high accountability standards consistent with major charity evaluators.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's high revenue growth (18.9%) helps mitigate liquidity risks.
risk_factors: <cite id="16">Working capital of 4.0 months</cite> provides a limited buffer for economic shifts.
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="15">lack of granular beneficiary data</cite> which prevents a precise calculation of cost-effectiveness.

confidence.notes: Very high financial transparency with Platinum Candid seal.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors as a <cite id="8">zakat-eligible organization</cite> serving <cite id="9">vulnerable populations in Pakistan</cite>.

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity could provide more detailed <cite id="15">outcome tracking metrics</cite> beyond financial grant totals.

rich_narrative.headline: SIUT North America Inc provides critical financial support for life-saving dialysis and kidney transplant services through the SIUT Charitable Trust.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to provide high-impact, specialized medical care like transplants and dialysis to the poor in Pakistan through a zakat-eligible channel.
donor_motivations: Want to support free specialized healthcare in Pakistan
Prioritize high financial efficiency and low overhead
Seek to fulfill zakat through medical aid
Value established institutions with long track records
giving_considerations: Funds are primarily used for international grants to a specific partner institution
High-cost procedures mean individual donations contribute to complex medical outcomes
Strong growth suggests the organization can effectively absorb larger gifts
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking local US-based medical programs or those requiring detailed cost-per-life-saved metrics.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects high-quality financial tracking of medical grants and a clear theory of change, though specific beneficiary outcome data is still developing.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: By providing grants for medicine and equipment to SIUT Karachi, the charity enables free, high-quality specialized medical care for those unable to afford it.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical grants are effectively translated into successful patient outcomes and life-saving procedures.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The demand for free dialysis and transplants in Pakistan significantly exceeds current funding levels.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="4">84.0% program expense ratio</cite> and focus on high-complexity transplants.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focus on education rather than healthcare
similar_organizations.name: The Citizens Foundation

strengths.detail: The charity operates with a <cite id="4">84.0% program expense ratio</cite> and a low fundraising cost of <cite id="7">$0.17 per $1 raised</cite>.
The organization holds an <cite id="10">overall score of 92.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and a <cite id="11">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>.
SIUT North America has achieved a <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 18.9%</cite>, indicating increasing donor trust and capacity.

strengths_deep_dive: SIUT North America's strength lies in its direct support model for specialized medical services. In 2024 alone, the organization provided <cite id="12">$5,141,716 in grants for medical equipment and medicine</cite>. This funding supports a comprehensive range of services in Pakistan, including <cite id="3">dialysis and kidney transplants</cite>, which are provided free of cost to patients. The organization's governance is robust, featuring a <cite id="13">board of 7 members</cite> with <cite id="14">84.0% independent board members</cite>, ensuring objective oversight of its multi-million dollar grantmaking activities.
rich_narrative.summary: SIUT North America Inc serves as a critical financial bridge for the Sindh Institute of Urology and Transplantation (SIUT) in Pakistan, an institution <cite id="1">founded in 2000</cite> to provide free medical care. The organization reported <cite id="2">$5,921,512 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year, reflecting its role as a primary funding vehicle for life-saving treatments including <cite id="3">dialysis, kidney transplants, and cancer treatment</cite>. By maintaining a <cite id="4">84.0% program expense ratio</cite> in its direct reporting, the charity ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions are converted into medical equipment and medicine for the underserved. The organization has demonstrated significant growth, achieving a <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 18.9%</cite>, which allows it to expand its support for complex procedures such as <cite id="6">liver and corneal transplants</cite>. Its operations are characterized by high efficiency, with a <cite id="7">fundraising cost of only $0.17 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that resources are directed toward patient care rather than administrative overhead. As a <cite id="8">zakat-eligible entity</cite>, it provides a verified pathway for Muslim donors to support medical humanitarianism in Pakistan, specifically serving the <cite id="9">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> who would otherwise lack access to specialized healthcare.
